Conformance Criteria Summary - Variation of reduced level of invert from specified level:
○ Whitin +/- 10 mm of specified position. Invert of structure shall not impede the gravity flow of water into or from structure

Conformance Criteria Summary - Unless specified otherwise, backfill layers shall be maximum 300 mm layers.

Conformance Criteria Summary - The pipe system must not lose more than a defined amount of pressure within the test duration.

4.2 - Finish level compliance with design drawings
Records or Checklist Document Number - WBS-SS-CI- ITP-920049
Records or Checklist Document Number - WBS-SS-CI- ITP-920049
Review of approved construction drawings and specifications
All drawings and specifications approved and up to date
Site access cleared and made safe
All personnel inducted; safety briefings completed
Dust, noise, and sediment barriers installed and functioning
Part 2 – Excavation and trenching (photos where applicable)
Trench depth and width comply with design
Set-out verified and matches IFC drawings
Trenches deeper than 1.5m require benching, or battering unless certified by a geotechnical engineer.
Pipes inspected for defects before installation
Material certs from manufacturer and visual inspection
Material to align with design drawings and load rating
No standing water or excessive moisture inside the trench.
Proper barricades and signage placed around excavation area.
Spoil stockpiles located at least 1m from trench edges
Stockpiles away from excavation to maintain safety of batters
Access and egress (ladders, steps) provided for trenches deeper than 1.2m
Access and egress for each trench.
Part 3 – Bedding & Pipe Installation (photos where applicable)
Correct bedding material used (sand, gravel, etc.)
Material complies with particle size, moisture content, MMDD
Pipes and materials inspected for defects before installation
Installed to design grade ±10mm and alignment within 5mm tolerance.
Pipes laid at correct grade and alignment
Levels and grading match design tolerances (+/- 20mm)
Correct pipe jointing method used (rubber ring, solvent weld, etc.)
Joints must be fully engaged and sealed per manufacturer specifications
Part 4 – Backfilling and compaction (photos where applicable)
Initial backfill material placed evenly around pipes
Site-won material approved by geotechnical engineer
No large rocks or debris in backfill
No rocks or debris in backfill
Backfill in uniform layers of maximum 300mm thickness
Backfill shall be placed to a depth of 300mm above collars of pipes or conduits
Compaction tests performed and passed (Proctor Density, NDM, etc.)
Surface reinstated as per project specs (concrete, asphalt, topsoil)
Backfill to match existing ground levels with ±10mm tolerance.
Part 5 – Final inspections and acceptance (photos where applicable)
The pipe system must not lose more than a defined amount of pressure within the test duration.
PVC - 25 kPa (3.5 psi) – pressure drop ≤3.5 kPa (0.5 psi) in 5 min.
Concrete - 25-50 kPa (3.5- 7.0 psi) – pressure drop ≤10% drop in 5 min.
As-built levels and layout match design
All temporary structures, barriers, and access points removed
All drainage activities completed and accepted
